content.description: A loose and somewhat awkward start leads to a solid and clean stemming corner. The crux is a blank section of the corner. After the corner, mantle onto a ledge and climb pockets and edges to the anchor.
content.location: On the Long Wall. Third bolt line right of the Cathedral. Look for the corner.

content.description: Climbs the obvious black streak on the right side of the long wall. Starts with some liebacks then some long moves between big holds leading to a crux moving through a scoop at the last bolt. Fun movement on good rock.
content.location: Look for the black streak as you pass the Cloud Buttress. Hike to where the cliffline comes almost to the approach trail then back track along the cliff. Whistler starts behind a detached pillar.

content.description: Bolted face in the middle of the Long Wall. Hardest individual moves are between the second and third bolt pulling on some shallow pockets. Then dog-leg left to a right-facing dihedral. For extra contrivance points, you can skip the obvious rest two bolts from the top. There is a variation that goes direct up the face to the anchor but the bolt hangers have been removed.
content.location: When looking at the cliff, Topaz is the fourth bolted line to the right of the Cathedral.

content.description: Continuous fingery pulling immediately left of the black streak.
content.location: Buttress left of Whistler (black streak) behind the detached pillar.

content.description: Climbs the chute two boltlines left of the black streak. Long reaches between good holds aided by stemming. Crux is between the 4th and 5th bolts. Some loose rock below the first bolt but solid after that.
content.location: Second boltline left of Whistler. Starts right of the boulder that starts "The Dagger".

content.description: Fun steep liebacking through a bulge leads to thin pockets and edges going up a  less-than-vertical wall to the top of the cliff. The difficulty comes from the continuous nature of the upper wall. Your personal climbing preferences will determine whether you love or hate this one.
content.protection: Bolts. Rap hangers. First bolt is high so stick clip might be nice though climbing is easy on the left, just slightly loose and sandy.
content.location: Second bolted climb outside the Cathedral.

content.description: Straightforward climbing gets you close to the roof. Crux is pulling to and then over the roof. The rest of the route is a long, technical slab.
content.location: The last route on the Long Wall before the Cathedral. Can usually be identified by a fixed sling that hangs off the fourth bolt under the roof.

content.description: Short and physical. Climbs the prominent rib feature. Start off the boulder and wrestle with the rib for a body-length. Then step right and stem/palm your way to the anchor with the help of a few pockets.
content.location: Close to where the Long wall meets the approach trail at the top of some sketchy steps. Furthest left bolt line in this little cluster of sport climbs.

content.description: Cliff that parallels the approach trail between the Cloud Buttress and the Cathedral. The left 2/3rds of the cliff has some decent climbs in the 11a-12a range. The right side is listed as "Orange Wall" in the guidebook and has harder steeper climbs on not-so-great rock. Cleaning might be required depending on the last time they were climbed. A few of the climbs have easy access from the top but be careful! Anchor bolts are below the lip of the cliff and there is loose rubble right up to the edge.
